reviews.text: We literally booked this last minute - booked on the Tuesday and arrived on the Thursday. A lovely set of apartments, very clean with someone coming in to clean and make the beds every day. We booked a one bedroom apartment with kitchenette and sea view and we weren't disappointed. Very spacious with all our needs catered to. The only thing I can really say negatively would be about breakfast, this is served from 8am until 10am, but if you want to ensure there's anything left other than sliced bread for toast or cereal, arrive early!! Skala is a quiet little town which suited us and if you're looking for somewhere for your evening meal, I would thoroughly recommend Siroco Restaurant on the main street. Fabulous food, very reasonably priced and Andreas and Karen are excellent hosts - we ate there every night and our only wish was that we were staying longer than a week. Will definitely be back.
reviews.title: A lovely set of apartments located on the outskirts of Skala

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a bit late in reviewing this hotel, as we went last September, but wanted to say how lovely it was. We wanted a last minute week a away in the sun and as someone who has been to quite a few Greek Islands this was one of the best trips we have had! The room we had a lovely view over Skala, and was so spacious and clean. Greek accommodation can sometimes be a bit basic but this was not at all. The pool was lovely too and never too busy. We ate a few times at the hotel too and the food was great. We loved Kefalonia, definitely one of the prettiest islands we have been too. We will definitely love to return!
reviews.title: Lovely Family Run Hotel!

reviews.text: This was such a good find! We really didn't want anything tacky, and this wasn't at all. We stayed for a week at the end of June into July, and it wasn't too busy at all but lovely and hot! The pool is lovely and the apartments are simple but very spacious! The small restaurant at the hotel is delicious, and lovely for eating a lunch by the pool. It wasn't a large complex which was perfect. We hired a car which did make the trip a lot easier, but it's not a long walk to skala, although it is up quite a long hill...! The staff were very friendly and lovely, and we'd definitely go back!!!!
reviews.title: Loved this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed from the 15th Sept to 29th Sept and would say it was an ideal hotel for a relaxing holiday, we had room 121 which was a one bed first floor apartment which had a large balcony with a fantastic view over Skala and the coastline, the rooms are very spacious and clean with a kettle, two ring hob, microwave, fridge, ample cooking equipment and plates mugs etc, and air conditioning at 5Euro per day, the staff are very helpful and will do anything to make your stay enjoyable, there is a safe in the room which is free and two computers in the reception with free internet connection, we had a car which we picked up at the airport for the whole of our stay which is a must as the walk to the center of Skala is far to long if you do not have a car you would need a taxi all the time, our last week was very quite as there where only 6 couple there in fact on our last day there was only one other couple left as the hotel closes down at the end of Sept
reviews.title: Very relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only reasons for not giving this hotel an excellent was one, the included breakfast got a bit boring having the same things every day (you can order other such as cook breakfast at extra cost) and two the boring back ground music that they repeat over and over again and as our apartment was next to the dining and pool areas i would have been quite happy without it. We only had dinner one night which was fine but as there are many restaurants in the town, (all very good) so we tried quite a few of them. All in all a very good hotel we would love to go again.
reviews.title: Good place to unstress

reviews.text: We have just returned from a fabulous two week holiday at Asteris and are reluctant to recommend the hotel as we would rather keep it our secret!!! We loved the situation 2 miles out of Skala and it's amazing views across the bay. Our 1 bedroom apartment was huge with plenty of space for us and our 2 teenage daughters. The pool area was always spotlessly clean, there were plenty of sunbeds and towels were provided. Breakfasts were good and ample. We ate at the hotel a couple of evenings and the food was very good. The families attention to detail at the hotel made for a truely memorable holiday.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!!

reviews.text: Having stayed in Skala 3 times as a couple we decided that we would visit with our boys who are 15 & 12 we really didn't want to have 2 rooms so chose the Asteris Hotel as it was an appartment that would sleep all of us. On arrival we were greeted by Costas the owner who showed us to the room which was a short walk fom the main body of the hotel - we were absolutely delighted the appartment was spotlessly clean, spacious and well equipped and even better we had our own room!!! The balcony itself was large and the view was spectacular. Air conditioning, pool towels, safe, internet computers, pool table and satellite television were all included in the price. There is an outdoor restaurant at the hotel which serves food from 08:00 - 21:00 we ate here a few times and it was very nice and reasonably priced. Costas does 2 trips in his minibus per night into Skala town (18:00 and 20:00) we used this service most nights. We didn't walk into town at all because it was far too hot but I think it would take best part of an hour and the money saved on air conditioning and safe helps towards the cost of taxis. Pool area is lovely very uncrowded with a good selection of music in the background, bar serves some very nice cocktails and beer comes in frosted glasses barman very friendly and nothing too much trouble. There is a weekly BBQ which we went to (10 euros adult, 8 euros child) very good value plenty of meat, salads, breads and a lovely desert they have a pianist and singer on BBQ night who play traditional Greek music at the poolside which was really nice - it certainly wasn't a show but more of an accompaniment to the food.
reviews.title: Can't fault it!!!

reviews.text: This was a really outstanding holiday and we have all been pining to go back - we are definitely going to book this hotel for next year but for a fortnight!!!
reviews.title: An amazing hotel for such a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The design of the hotel was modern and well considered. The room was very large and comfortable with everything you need there. The staff were friendly and courteous without being intrusive. The best thing however was the view - both from the fantastic pool as well as from the room. It felt like a much more expensive hotel. Being about a 10 min drive from the local town of Skala was not a problem for us, even though we didn't hire a car, as the hotel has a shuttle bus and there are numerous taxis for about 5 euro.
reviews.title: Beat all expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was a bit of a let-down. A perfectly fine breakfast and the salads were nice and generous portions. We were on a B&B basis, and glad we weren't all-inclusive as the food at the local tavernas is so much better - the main meals were just a bit lack-lustre.
reviews.title: cant wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what a amazing week my husband and i had there this sept. It is in a beautiful situation on the hill overlooking the sea with zante over the other side..the accommodation was very good, apartment was on the corner with one of the best views, very clean, very spacious with kitchenette, with very helpful staff. It was so relaxing and quiet at this time as they closed for the winter the day we left, but we did enjoy 32 degrees all week and it was a couples dream at this time if you were wanting a chilled week together ..You do really need a car, it is a good 45min walk to town (skala) going down hill but a much harder walk back. Costas (the owner) does have a mini bus which goes into the town (skala) every night (except sunday) at 6pm and 8pm free of charge, you just need to get a taxi back approx 6 euros.. We went for a day trip one day to poros, sami, and upto fisckardo (fishing village) where we had a fabulous fish lunch and came back down to asos (stunning) and myrthos beach...(WOW) so glad we did that trip.. We paid for breakfast at the hotel, which for the money was excellent.. cereals, yog, fruit and jams... toast, hams, cheese, toms and hard boiled eggs with tea, coffee, juice etc but we eat out every night in skala... Our absolute favourite was the "scananavian" as the locals know it, the food was amazing... i can't tell you how much kefalonian meat pie i had there.. which you couldnt get at many of the restaurants, but we tried 5 diff dishes, and all were top dollar.. The captains bar is great for cocktails and music and "my way" bar is good for any of you sports fans for the tv. I really think you would struggle to complain about anything here... Costas and his staff are very good and we will definately be going back in 2013
reviews.title: a much needed holiday which made it all worth waiting for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited this hotel in May 2012 and have just come back from a second visit there this year. That in itself says a lot about the place.
reviews.title: Second visit to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was excellent - decent size with a lovely big balcony overlooking the sea with table and chairs out there to take a glass of wine and admire the view.
reviews.title: annual holiday

reviews.text: The room was well equipped with air con (extra charge) a full bathroom - complete with a bath and also a shower curtain. Mini kitchen with enough crockery, cutlery and pans if you wanted to make an odd snack - or even a small meal in the room. A microwave was provided in the room too - great if you couldnt finish your meal and brought home a bit of left over greek food !
reviews.title: Great Find
Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in our booking and I have to say it was well worth paying the little bit extra for this. Plenty of choice including the ever popular cheese, ham, cereals, toast, fresh fruit

reviews.title: wonderfully peaceful escape.
reviews.text: Just returned from the Asteris & thoroughly enjoyed it. We took a taxi for €55 from the airport & it took around 50min to get there. Warm & friendly welcome. Room 144 was spacious & spotlessly clean with a wonderful sea view. We didn't get the sun til late afternoon on the balcony & it didn't hit the windows so the room stayed quite cool which was a godsend for me. Aircon €5 per day & worth every penny. We didn't pay for breakfast & just ate our shop bought muesli & greek yoghurt every morning. The poolside cafe/restaurant is great. Tasty, affordable food. The Mon eve BBQs were worth the €10 a head. The pool was clean & inviting. Although the hotel was full the pool area never felt full or busy. Pool towels are available.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Previous reviewers have mentioned walking into Scala but in my opinion it's too far/hot for such nonsense, tried it once, nearly lost the will to live! The owner provides a free minibus 6 nights a week at 6pm & 8pm but you need to prebook as it soon fills up, otherwise a taxi costs €6 each way. That was the only drawback for us but we had a car so we got out & about. All guests are guaranteed a good time & a warm welcome here.
reviews.title: Great hotel, fabulous views, lovely staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from yet another fantastic week at the Asteris...3rd year in a row its that good... The staff are so friendly and accommodating...nothing is too much trouble. The food is fantastic... lots of homemade treats!! The rooms are clean, modern and spacious and the views from the huge balconies are outstanding...
reviews.title: first class

reviews.text: The common areas are spotless as is the pool area... they even provide you with towels which you can just help yourself to and change each day if you wanted, although we're conscious of the environment so chose not to change them quite so regularly. We used to pop off to the beach each day for a few hours and the hotel even provides you with an umbrella to take with you to shade you from the sun.
reviews.title: Stunning views, very helpful staff

reviews.text: The hotel is about 5km outside of Skala but the early evening walk is lovely, although alternatively the hotel has a courtesy bus or its only 6 Euros in a taxi. The location of the hotel perched up on the hill outside of Skala was one of the most appealing aspects for us - peace, tranquility and outstanding views.
reviews.title: Beautiful place. Friendliest staff ever
